-| wceq(c2, cfv(cabv, c0))
-| wceq(c3, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c4, cfv(c0g, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cmpt(s0, c3, cif(nat0, nat1, wceq(cv(s0), c4))))
-| diffsc(s0, c0)
-| diffsc(s0, c3)
-| diffsc(s0, c4)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(c0, cdr))
-| diffsw(hs1, wcel(c0, cdr))
-| diffsc(s0, cdr)
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ DivRing → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c2 =(AbsVal ` c0)
⊣ c3 =(Base ` c0)
⊣ c4 =(0 ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(s0 ∈ c3 ↦ if(s0 = c4, 0, 1))
⊣ d(s0, c0)
⊣ d(s0, c3)
⊣ d(s0, c4)
⊣ d(hs0, c0 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ d(hs1, c0 ∈ DivRing)
⊣ d(s0, DivRing)

comment: The trivial absolute value. (This theorem is true as long as ` R ` is a domain, but it is not true for rings with zero divisors, which violate the multiplication axiom; ~ abvdom is the converse of this remark.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-May-2015.)
